target_text: "But for the purpose of a definition, I would say quality takes place in the process level and the software level."

codebook.justification: All roles (Software Developer, UX/UI Designer, Project Manager, Quality Assurance Engineer, DevOps Engineer) recognize the importance of quality at the process level, emphasizing methodologies, workflows, and efficiency in software development.
All roles agree on the significance of quality at the software level, focusing on attributes like performance, reliability, and user satisfaction in the final product.
Multiple roles (Project Manager, Quality Assurance Engineer, UX/UI Designer) highlight the attempt to define quality, indicating a shared interest in establishing clear standards and benchmarks.
Both parties agree to merge into 'quality_levels' as the text's use of 'levels' is more accurate than 'dimensions' while preserving the partitioning idea.
The text's focus on 'levels' [L 1-2] is the most accurate interpretation, capturing both technical and potential user-facing aspects without over-specifying UX.
The text's coverage of both levels [L 1-2] warrants coding, but 'quality_span' better reflects this without assuming unstated integration.
Both parties agree to merge to 'quality_levels' as it best captures the text's neutral description of levels without role-specific interpretations.
